intro: Noronhia obtusifolia var. minoriflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved noronhia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and a glossy appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
